metadata.title: Supabase Google OAuth Support on Login and Signup Pages
metadata.prd_reference: Supabase auth + multi-user access onboarding/login flows

context.background: User wants Healio login to use Google via Supabase. Login page already has partial Google OAuth support; signup page needs parity and the flow should be verified.

design_constraints.constraint: Keep auth UX in-context (Stripe-like) with clear error feedback when Supabase is not configured.
Preserve safe callback routing through `/auth/callback` and `next` path validation.
Avoid breaking local provisioning/test paths used for implementation demos.

instruction.step: Add or complete Google OAuth sign-in support on auth pages, including signup page parity where missing.
Ensure OAuth redirects route through `/auth/callback` and preserve safe `next` path behavior.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify login/signup UI surfaces the Google action and auth pages render without console errors.

validation_checklist.check: Login page exposes a working Google OAuth action using Supabase browser client.
Signup page exposes Google OAuth action or clearly integrated Google auth entry point.
Chrome DevTools MCP verification is recorded for `/login` and `/signup`.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: Google OAuth entry point is available on Healio auth pages and uses Supabase OAuth with provider=`google`.
Task XML is updated with evidence and renamed `DONE_` on completion.

output_spec.commit_message: feat(healio-auth): add supabase google oauth support on auth pages

evidence.item: Record changed auth files, typecheck command, Chrome DevTools MCP verification notes, and commit refs.

execution_tracking.completion_signal: Task is done only when state=DONE, is_done=true, completed_at is filled, verification_status=PASSED, and evidence is recorded.

references.verification_tool: Chrome DevTools MCP (required for frontend task verification)
